trans-unit.source: Suggesters
trans-unit.target: Suggesters

trans-unit.source: The suggestions feature in Azure Search is a type-ahead or auto-complete query capability, providing a list of potential search terms in response to partial string inputs entered into a search box.
trans-unit.target: The suggestions feature in Azure Search is a type-ahead or auto-complete query capability, providing a list of potential search terms in response to partial string inputs entered into a search box.

trans-unit.source: You've probably noticed query suggestions when using commercial web search engines: typing ".NET" in Bing produces a list of terms for ".NET 4.5", ".NET Framework 3.5", and so forth.
trans-unit.target: You've probably noticed query suggestions when using commercial web search engines: typing ".NET" in Bing produces a list of terms for ".NET 4.5", ".NET Framework 3.5", and so forth.

trans-unit.source: Using the service REST API, implementing suggestions in a custom Azure Search application requires the following:
trans-unit.target: Using the service REST API, implementing suggestions in a custom Azure Search application requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Enable suggestions by adding a <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> construction in your index, giving the name, search mode, and a list of fields for which type-ahead is invoked.
trans-unit.target: Enable suggestions by adding a <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> construction in your index, giving the name, search mode, and a list of fields for which type-ahead is invoked.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you specify "cityName" as a source field, typing a partial search string of "Sea" will result in "Seattle", "Seaside", and "Seatac" (all three are actual city names) offered up as query suggestions to the user.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you specify "cityName" as a source field, typing a partial search string of "Sea" will result in "Seattle", "Seaside", and "Seatac" (all three are actual city names) offered up as query suggestions to the user.

trans-unit.source: Invoke suggestions by calling the <link xlink:href="b3fed159-774d-42e0-8ded-ee453f6cd857" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Suggestions API</link>in your application code.
trans-unit.target: Invoke suggestions by calling the <link xlink:href="b3fed159-774d-42e0-8ded-ee453f6cd857" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Suggestions API</link>in your application code.

trans-unit.source: Typically partial search strings are sent to the service while the user is typing a search query, and this API returns a set of suggested phrases.
trans-unit.target: Typically partial search strings are sent to the service while the user is typing a search query, and this API returns a set of suggested phrases.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to configure a <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to configure a <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: You should also review the <link xlink:href="b3fed159-774d-42e0-8ded-ee453f6cd857" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Suggestions API</link> for details on how a <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> is used.
trans-unit.target: You should also review the <link xlink:href="b3fed159-774d-42e0-8ded-ee453f6cd857" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Suggestions API</link> for details on how a <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> is used.

trans-unit.source: Usage
trans-unit.target: Usage

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Suggesters</languageKeyword> are created in the index and work best when used to suggest specific documents rather than loose terms or phrases.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Suggesters</languageKeyword> are created in the index and work best when used to suggest specific documents rather than loose terms or phrases.

trans-unit.source: The best candidate fields are titles, names, and other relatively short phrases that can identify an item.
trans-unit.target: The best candidate fields are titles, names, and other relatively short phrases that can identify an item.

trans-unit.source: Less effective are repetitive fields, such as categories and tags, or very long fields such as descriptions or comments fields.
trans-unit.target: Less effective are repetitive fields, such as categories and tags, or very long fields such as descriptions or comments fields.

trans-unit.source: As part of the index definition, you can add a single <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> to the <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> collection.
trans-unit.target: As part of the index definition, you can add a single <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> to the <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> collection.

trans-unit.source: Properties that define a <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> include the following:
trans-unit.target: Properties that define a <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> include the following:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The name of the <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The name of the <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: You use the name of the <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> when calling the <link xlink:href="b3fed159-774d-42e0-8ded-ee453f6cd857" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Suggestions API</link>.
trans-unit.target: You use the name of the <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> when calling the <link xlink:href="b3fed159-774d-42e0-8ded-ee453f6cd857" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Suggestions API</link>.

trans-unit.source: The strategy used to search for candidate phrases.
trans-unit.target: The strategy used to search for candidate phrases.

trans-unit.source: The only mode currently supported is <codeInline>analyzingInfixMatching</codeInline>, which performs flexible matching of phrases at the beginning or in the middle of sentences.
trans-unit.target: The only mode currently supported is <codeInline>analyzingInfixMatching</codeInline>, which performs flexible matching of phrases at the beginning or in the middle of sentences.

trans-unit.source: A list of one or more fields that are the source of the content for suggestions.
trans-unit.target: A list of one or more fields that are the source of the content for suggestions.

trans-unit.source: Only fields of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline> and <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline> may be sources for suggestions.
trans-unit.target: Only fields of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline> and <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline> may be sources for suggestions.

trans-unit.source: Only fields that don't have a custom language analyzer set can be used.
trans-unit.target: Only fields that don't have a custom language analyzer set can be used.

trans-unit.source: If you used the public preview version of Azure Search, <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> replaces an older boolean field property (<codeInline>"suggestions": false</codeInline>) that only supported prefix suggestions for short strings (3-25 characters).
trans-unit.target: If you used the public preview version of Azure Search, <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> replaces an older boolean field property (<codeInline>"suggestions": false</codeInline>) that only supported prefix suggestions for short strings (3-25 characters).

trans-unit.source: Its replacement, <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword>, supports infix matching that finds matching terms at the beginning or in the middle of field content, with better tolerance for mistakes in search strings.
trans-unit.target: Its replacement, <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword>, supports infix matching that finds matching terms at the beginning or in the middle of field content, with better tolerance for mistakes in search strings.

trans-unit.source: This is now the only implementation of the suggestions API.
trans-unit.target: This is now the only implementation of the suggestions API.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>suggestions</codeInline> property that was introduced in <codeInline>api-version=2014-07-31-Preview</codeInline> continues to work in that version, but is not operational in newer versions of Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>suggestions</codeInline> property that was introduced in <codeInline>api-version=2014-07-31-Preview</codeInline> continues to work in that version, but is not operational in newer versions of Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Transition code from preview to the generally available release</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-transition-from-preview/</linkUri></externalLink> for guidance on how to update your code.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Transition code from preview to the generally available release</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-transition-from-preview/</linkUri></externalLink> for guidance on how to update your code.

trans-unit.source: Suggester example
trans-unit.target: Suggester example

trans-unit.source: A <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> is part of the index.
trans-unit.target: A <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> is part of the index.

trans-unit.source: Only one <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> can exist in the <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> collection in the current version, alongside the <languageKeyword>fields</languageKeyword> collection and <languageKeyword>scoringProfiles</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: Only one <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> can exist in the <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> collection in the current version, alongside the <languageKeyword>fields</languageKeyword> collection and <languageKeyword>scoringProfiles</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Search .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Azure Search .NET SDK
